basics.name: Albert Einstein
basics.label: Scientist
basics.summary: A German-born theoretical physicist, widely ranked among the greatest and most influential scientists of all time

work.name: Institute for Advanced Study, Princeton University
work.summary: Teaching at Palmer Physical Laboratory (now 302 Frist Campus Center). While not a professor at Princeton, I associated with the physics professors and continued to give lectures on campus.

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine

awards.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
awards.summary: The Nobel Prizes are five separate prizes that, according to Alfred Nobel's will of 1895, are awarded to 'those who, during the preceding year, have conferred the greatest benefit to humankind.'

publications.name: Zur Elektrody/namik bewegter Körper
publications.summary: It concerned an interpretation of the Michelson–Morley experiment and the properties of light and time. Special relativity incorporates the principle that the speed of light is the same for all inertial observers regardless of the state of motion of the source.

publications.name: Über einen die Erzeugung und Verwandlung des Lichtes betreffenden heuristischen Gesichtspunkt
publications.summary: In the second paper, he applied the quantum theory to light to explain the photoelectric effect. In particular, he used the idea of light quanta (photons) to explain experimental results, but stressed the importance of the experimental results. The importance of his work on the photoelectric effect earned him the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1921.

publications.name: Die Grundlage der allgemeinen Relativitätstheorie
publications.summary: The publication of the theory of general relativity made him internationally famous. He was professor of physics at the universities of Zurich (1909–1911) and Prague (1911–1912), before he returned to ETH Zurich (1912–1914).

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.

responsibilities: Experimental reinforcement learning using reduced action space for more efficient exploration of over-actuated environments.
Implemented control pipeline for Franka Emika FR3 robot using libfranka and ROS.
Creation of MuJoCo simulation environment for learning lego manipulation with Franka Emika Panda.
Maintained Python script for parametric generation of chip interconnect network with added support for mesh interconnect topology.
Created SystemVerilog + C API for writing C-based Network-On-Chip tests in full-chip simulation.
Designed and optimized RISC-V CPU for data movement engine using Chipyard Rocket Chip generator, including benchmarking and optimizing memory system, bus widths, CDC, etc. for optimal PPA.

experience.location: University of Toronto Institute for Aerospace Studies
responsibilities: Analyzed flow solver performance to identify avenues for improving CFD algorithms.
Researched unconventional methods to create meshes more quickly and easily.
Implemented finite-difference algorithms for solving partial differential equations.

experience.organization: University of Toronto Formula SAE Team
responsibilities: Used StarCCM to run simulations and optimize parameters for aerodynamic performance.
Automated UI testing and creation of documentation using TestComplete and Python.
Improved scalability and automation of UI testing process using Azure DevOps.

projects.name: Design and training of variant chess engine using CNNs
details: Supervised training of a CNN model to perform chess board evaluation function.
Implementation of heuristic search for atomic chess using trained evaluation function.

projects.name: Built a mobile robot with path following and obstacle avoidance
details: Control using Arduino Uno. Scanning ultrasonic sensor to detect obstacles and perform path-finding.

projects.name: Programming TurtleBot Waffle Pi robots
details: Manually implemented Bayesian methods using ROS to localize robot using landmarks.

achievements_certifications.name: Kenneth Ward Smith Scholarship, FASE Scholarship
AP Scholar Award
details: Awarded for the achievement of three perfect 5/5 scores on AP examinations.
